titleStmt.title: The Parliaments endevors for setling of peace in this kingdom, being an order by them made to conioyne the subiects hearts in unity, according to the protestation formerly set forth. With the manner of apprehending Sir Basil Brooks at the city of Yorke; with the Parliaments order for bringing him to London. Their care and sedulous counsell for guarding the Tower; as also for strengthening his Maiesties castles and forts towards the sea for prevention of invasions. Being ordered the 29 of Ianuary 1642. Written and avowed by Richard Browene.
titleStmt.author: Browne, Richard, Sir, 1602?-1669.
